subject: Inner-class Testing:  How to distribute without junit.jar?
messageBody:
> I understand that when using the Inner-class testing module with NetBeans
> that I can distribute my app without the .class files for the TEST inner
> classes. But it seems to me that I would still need to distribute the
> junit.jar file. Is this the case? We can't seem to standardize on any
> sort of unit testing mechanism here, and I'm pretty sure my code would get
> rejected by Q/A if it required a .jar that wasn't used except for testing.
>
> Any way around this?
>
